meanings.definition: To cause to occur or operate at the same time
meanings.sent1: The conductor synchronizes the musicians to play together.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light synchronizes the flow of cars on the road.
meanings.sent3: The clock that synchronizes all the watches decided to take a break.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves synchronizes perfectly with the music, like a well-choreographed routine.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers moved in perfect harmony, like a beautiful water ballet.

meanings.sent1: The coach synchronizes the team's plays during the game.
meanings.sent2: The event planner synchronizes the schedule for the conference.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock decided to synchronize with the sunrise for a change.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky seem to synchronize their twinkling, creating a mesmerizing display.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized clapping of the audience added to the excitement of the performance.

meanings.definition: To match the timing of two or more things
meanings.sent1: The software synchronizes the data between the devices seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The dancers synchronize their steps to the beat of the music.
meanings.sent3: The traffic lights synchronized their blinking, causing confusion among drivers.
meanings.sent4: The synchronized movements of the birds in flight painted a beautiful picture in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized fireworks display lit up the night sky in a breathtaking spectacle.
